model module

class model.BiLSTMModel(encoder, config, tokenizer, args)[source]

Bases: Module

A bidirectional LSTM model for sequence-based classification tasks, with a linear layer for label prediction.

fit()[source]
forward(input_ids=None, labels=None)[source]

Forward pass of the BiLSTM model to compute probabilities and, if labels are provided, loss.

Parameters:

  • input_ids (torch.Tensor, optional) – Tensor containing token IDs, by default None.

  • labels (torch.Tensor, optional) – True labels for computing loss, by default None.

Returns:

Returns loss and probabilities if labels are provided, otherwise probabilities only.

Return type:

tuple or torch.Tensor

predict(input_ids=None)[source]

Predicts class labels for the given input IDs.

Parameters:

input_ids (list or np.array, optional) – List of token IDs for prediction, by default None.

Returns:

Predicted class labels.

Return type:

np.array

predict_proba(input_ids=None)[source]

Computes probability distributions over classes for given input IDs.

Parameters:

input_ids (list or np.array, optional) – List of token IDs for prediction, by default None.

Returns:

Probability distributions for each class.

Return type:

np.array

training: bool
class model.Bug_detection(model=None, dataset=None, calibration_data=None, args=None)[source]

Bases: ModelDefinition

Class for bug detection using a pre-trained model, handling data partitioning, feature extraction, and making predictions.

data_partitioning(dataset='../../../benchmark/Bug', random_seed=1234, num_folders=8, calibration_ratio=0.2, args=None)[source]

Partitions the data into training, validation, and test sets, selecting a subset of files from specified folders within the dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str, optional) – Path to the dataset directory, by default “../../../benchmark/Bug”.

  • random_seed (int, optional) – Seed for randomization, by default 1234.

  • num_folders (int, optional) – Number of folders to sample from, by default 8.

  • calibration_ratio (float, optional) – Ratio of data to be used for calibration, by default 0.2.

  • args (object, optional) – Additional arguments for data partitioning, by default None.

feature_extraction(srcs)[source]

Extracts features from source code inputs using a tokenizer.

Parameters:

srcs (list) – List of source code strings for feature extraction.

Returns:

Encoded and padded sequence of tokens.

Return type:

np.array

predict(X, significant_level=0.1)[source]

Makes predictions with the model for given input data.

Parameters:

  • X (list) – Input data to make predictions on.

  • significant_level (float, optional) – Significance level for predictions, by default 0.1.

Returns:

Prediction labels and probabilities.

Return type:

tuple

class model.Model(encoder, config, tokenizer, args)[source]

Bases: Module

A generic neural network model with an encoder for processing inputs, and predicting probabilities or labels.

fit()[source]

Placeholder for fitting the model if needed.

forward(input_ids=None, labels=None)[source]

Forward pass of the model to compute logits and probability distributions.

Parameters:

  • input_ids (torch.Tensor, optional) – Tensor containing token IDs, by default None.

  • labels (torch.Tensor, optional) – True labels for computing loss, by default None.

Returns:

Returns loss and probabilities if labels are provided, otherwise probabilities only.

Return type:

tuple or torch.Tensor

predict(input_ids=None, labels=None)[source]

Predicts class labels for the given input IDs.

Parameters:

input_ids (list or np.array, optional) – List of token IDs for prediction, by default None.

Returns:

Predicted class labels.

Return type:

np.array

predict_proba(input_ids=None, labels=None)[source]

Computes the probabilities for each class based on the input IDs.

Parameters:

input_ids (list or np.array, optional) – List of token IDs for prediction, by default None.

Returns:

Probability distributions for each class.

Return type:

np.array
